guide: How To Create a 2-Texture Material for Vertex Color Painting
description: This page shows you a specific example of how to create and use a Two-Texture Material for use with vertex color painting on Meshes.

overview.title: 2-Texture Material for Vertex Color Painting
overview.description: Demonstrates how to create a two-texture Material that blends a rock texture and a moss texture for vertex color painting.

steps_list.title: Create the Material
steps_list.description: In the Content Browser, click Add New > Material. Name the material (e.g., M_2TextureMoss). Double-click the new Material to open the Material Editor.

steps_list.title: Create and Set Up TextureSample Nodes
description: Right-click in the graph, search for TextureSample, and add four TextureSample nodes.
Select the top two nodes and assign Diffuse textures (e.g., T_Rock_Basalt_D and T_Ground_Grass_D).
Select the bottom two nodes and assign Normal maps (e.g., T_Rock_Basalt_N and T_Ground_Grass_N).

steps_list.title: Add the Vertex Color and Linear Interpolation Nodes
description: Add a VertexColor node to the graph.
Add two LinearInterpolate (Lerp) nodes to the graph.
Connect the Diffuse textures to the first Lerp node (Rock to A, Grass to B).
Connect the Normal maps to the second Lerp node (Rock to A, Grass to B).
Connect the VertexColor node to the Alpha input of both Lerp nodes.
Connect the Diffuse Lerp node to the Base Color input and the Normal Lerp node to the Normal input on the Material node.

steps_list.title: Set Up Remaining Material Properties
description: Add a Constant node and set its value to 0. Connect it to the Metallic and Specular inputs.
Add another Constant node and set its value to 1. Connect it to the Roughness input.

steps_list.title: Final Result
steps_list.description: The Material can now be used with Vertex Color painting to paint textures on a mesh. Adjust Brush settings (Strength, Radius, Falloff) to vary the texture application.

description: This page describes settings for various parts of the Mesh Paint Tool.

overview.title: Mesh Paint Tool Reference
overview.description: Inside the Mesh Paint mode panel, various options are available for using the mesh paint system, each with its own settings for painting vertex color, blending between textures, or painting directly onto the texture file.

painting_methods.title: Vertex Painting Methods
painting_methods.description: The Mesh Paint Tool has three different painting modes: Vertex Color Painting, Vertex Weight Painting, and Texture Weight Painting.

methods.name: Vertex Color Painting
methods.description: Paint vertex colors on your mesh and access its available properties. Switch between Paint Color and Erase Color by pressing the X key.

settings.name: Paint Color
settings.description: The color applied while painting (LMB + Drag). Click the swatch to open the Color Picker. Type values into the R, G, B, and A fields.

settings.name: Erase Color
settings.description: The color used as the 'eraser' color while erasing (SHIFT + LMB + Drag). Click the swatch to open the Color Picker. Type values into the R, G, B, and A fields.

settings.name: Channels
settings.description: Check boxes to set which color/alpha channels are affected by the paint brush.

settings.name: LOD Model Painting
settings.description: The specific Level of Detail (LOD) that vertex color painting will be applied to.

methods.name: Vertex Weight Painting
methods.description: Paint vertex weights on your mesh and access its available properties.

settings.name: Texture Weight Type
settings.description: Configures the blend weight 'strategy' by setting the number of textures to blend between.

types.name: Alpha (Two Textures)
types.description: Provides 2 texture channels, controlled by painting alpha. Requires a 2-way alpha lerp blend material.

types.name: RGB (Three Textures)
types.description: Provides 3 texture channels, controlled by painting RGB values. Requires a 3-way lerp blend material.

types.name: ARGB (Four Textures)
types.description: Provides 4 texture channels, controlled by painting ARGB values. Requires a 4-way lerp blend material.

types.name: ARGB - 1 (Five Textures)
types.description: Provides 5 texture channels, controlled by painting ARGB values. An internal one minus calculation on the alpha provides a fifth channel for blending. Requires a 5-way lerp blend material.

settings.name: Paint Texture Weight Index
settings.description: The texture Blend Weight index used when applied during painting.

settings.name: Erase Texture Weight Index
settings.description: The texture Blend Weight index used when erased during painting.

methods.name: Texture Weight Painting
methods.description: Paint on textures and access its available properties. Cycle through textures using the Toolbar or by pressing the period (.) and comma (,) keys. Commit changes using the toolbar or by pressing CTRL + SHIFT + C.

settings.name: Paint Color
settings.description: The color applied while painting (LMB + Drag). Click the swatch to open the Color Picker. Type values into the R, G, B, and A fields.

settings.name: Erase Color
settings.description: The color applied while erasing (SHIFT + LMB + Drag). Click the swatch to open the Color Picker. Type values into the R, G, B, and A fields.

settings.name: Enable Seam Painting
settings.description: If checked, dilation is used to allow painting of texture seams.

settings.name: Channels
settings.description: Check boxes to set which color/alpha channels are affected by the paint brush.

settings.name: UV Channel
settings.description: The UV channel of the selected Actor that will be used for the painted texture.

settings.name: Paint Texture
settings.description: Shows the texture to apply painting to. Click the Name field to the right of the swatch to change the texture.

settings.name: Previous Texture
settings.description: Cycles to the previous texture. (Comma)

settings.name: Next Texture
settings.description: Cycles to the next texture. (Period)

settings.name: Commit Texture
settings.description: Commits texture painting changes. (Ctrl-Shift-C)

mesh_paint_tools.title: Mesh Paint Tools
mesh_paint_tools.description: Tools to select your mesh and change vertex color data when using Vertex Color Painting or Vertex Weight Painting.

tools.name: Swap Colors
tools.description: Swap the Paint color and Erase color used for Mesh Painting. (X)

tools.name: Fill
tools.description: Fill the Mesh or instance being painted using the Paint color, respecting the Channels settings.

tools.name: Apply
tools.description: Propagate vertex colors on the instance to the source Meshes. (Formerly the Propagate tool.)

tools.name: Import
tools.description: Import a TGA image file to populate the vertex colors of the selected instances.

tools.name: Save
tools.description: Save the source Meshes for the selected Mesh instances.

tools.name: Copy
tools.description: Copy the vertex colors from the selected instance to the source Mesh asset.

tools.name: Paste
tools.description: Paste vertex colors on the selected Mesh instances.

tools.name: Remove
tools.description: Remove vertex colors from the selected Mesh instances.

tools.name: Fix
tools.description: Fix vertex colors applied to the selected Meshes.

tools.name: All LODs
tools.description: Apply the vertex colors from LOD0 to all LOD levels. (Formerly the Apply tool.)

tools.name: Previous LOD
tools.description: Cycle to the previous possible Mesh LOD level to Paint on. (B)

tools.name: Next LOD
tools.description: Cycle to the next possible Mesh LOD level to Paint on. (N)

brush_settings.title: Brush Settings
brush_settings.description: Settings for the brush used in Mesh Paint Tool, designed for wide areas or fine details.

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: Sets the radius of the brush in Unreal units. Adjust with CTRL + Left Bracket ([) to decrease, and CTRL + Right Bracket (]) to increase.

settings.name: Strength
settings.description: Sets the amount of paint to apply each time you click or move the mouse cursor while painting is enabled.

settings.name: Falloff
settings.description: Sets how the brush's strength falls off with distance. A falloff value of 1.0 means 100% strength at the center, fading linearly to the radius.

settings.name: Enable Brush Flow
settings.description: Configures the brush to apply paint to every single render frame, similar to an airbrush.

settings.name: Ignore Back-Facing
settings.description: Ignore triangles facing away from the camera so they are not affected by the paint brush.

visualization.title: Visualization
visualization.description: Settings to view the painted vertex colors individually or all together.

settings.name: Color View Mode
settings.description: Enable different view modes to visualize how vertex color is being applied to your Meshes within the Viewport.

modes.name: Off
modes.description: Restores the default Editor View Mode.

modes.name: RGB Channels
modes.description: Displays the Actors unlit, with RGB vertex colors showing.

modes.name: Alpha Channel
modes.description: Displays the Actors unlit, with only vertex alpha.

modes.name: Red Channel
modes.description: Displays the Actors unlit, with Red vertex color.

modes.name: Green Channel
modes.description: Displays the Actors unlit, with Green vertex color.

modes.name: Blue Channel
modes.description: Displays the Actors unlit, with Blue vertex color.

description: This page shows how to copy vertex color from one instance to another.

overview.title: Painting on Instances
overview.description: When painting vertex colors, you are only painting on an individual Instance of the Material and not the actual Material Asset itself. Use the Mesh Paint Toolbar's Colors tab to copy and paste the data onto another mesh or multiple meshes.

instance_color_size.title: Instance Color Size
instance_color_size.description: Displays the number of bytes of memory used by the vertex color data in the Mesh Paint panel, reflecting the total for all Assets currently selected.

commands.title: Commands
commands.description: Commands available in the Mesh Paint Toolbar's Colors tab for managing vertex color data.

commands_list.description: Copies the instance vertex color data for the selected Mesh. See Sharing Instance Color Data and the Mesh Paint Tool Reference for more information.
Pastes instance vertex color data that was previously copied. See Sharing Instance Color Data and the Mesh Paint Tool Reference for more information.
Discards the data for all selected Meshes and restores the default vertex colors. See the Mesh Paint Tool Reference for more information.
Attempts to match stored instance data on re-imported Meshes with different vertex counts. See Vertex Color Matching and the Mesh Paint Tool Reference for more information.

guide: How to Share Vertex Color Data Between Instances
description: This page shows how to transfer vertex color data across meshes using Mesh Paint Mode.

overview.title: Sharing Vertex Color Data
overview.description: Paint a mesh and share the vertex colors with other instances of the mesh in the same level. Use the Copy and Paste tools in the Mesh Paint Toolbar.

steps.title: Steps to Copy and Paste Vertex Color Data

steps_list.step: Select the instance that contains the color data you want to copy and click the Copy icon.
Select the instance(s) to copy the color data to and click the Paste icon.
The color data should now be applied to all of the instances.

description: A tool which allows vertex colors to be repaired when a new version of a mesh is imported with a different vertex count.

overview.title: Vertex Color Matching
overview.description: When a Static Mesh is reimported with a different vertex count, vertex colors on the instance can become mismatched, causing errors. The Fix tool in the Mesh Paint Toolbar corrects this issue.

errors.title: Common Errors
errors.description: Errors like 'StaticMeshActor_73 (LOD 0) has hand-painted vertex colors that no longer match the original StaticMesh' occur when vertex counts mismatch, causing visual issues or missing vertex colors on consoles.

fix_tool_usage.title: Using the Fix Tool
fix_tool_usage.description: The Fix tool is available in the Mesh Paint Toolbar to correct vertex color mismatches.

steps.step: Select the instance with mismatched vertex colors.
Click the Fix tool in the Mesh Paint Toolbar.
The Fix tool corrects vertex colors to match the original Static Mesh Asset.

availability.title: Tool Availability
availability.description: The Fix tool is only available if a Mesh needs fixing; otherwise, it is disabled.

effectiveness.title: Tool Effectiveness
effectiveness.description: The Fix tool works well for small changes. More extreme changes might not match colors perfectly, but the tool ensures some color match. It is not automatic to allow easy reversal of the fix if needed.

examples.title: Examples
examples.description: Comparison of the original mesh before and after applying the Fix tool.

description: An overview of the process of color selection for Mesh Paint Mode.

overview.title: Color Selection in Mesh Paint Mode
overview.description: The Mesh Paint tool relies on a pair of colors: Paint Color and Erase Color. Users can swap between them at any time using a standard Color Picker window.

erase_color.title: Erase Color
erase_color.description: For workflow purposes, think of the Erase Color as an alternate paint color rather than a tool that removes previous strokes. It acts like painting with a different color.

swap_and_reset.title: Swap and Reset Colors
swap_and_reset.description: Use the Swap icon to reverse the Paint and Erase colors. Use the Reset icon to return to the default colors for all channels (RGBA) or individually. Default Paint color is white (1, 1, 1, 1) and Erase color is black (0, 0, 0, 1).

toolbar_functions.title: Toolbar Functions
toolbar_functions.description: Clicking on Swap Colors in the Modes Toolbar functions the same as the Swap icon in the Mesh Paint panel.

color_picker.title: Color Picker
color_picker.description: The Color Picker provides various ways to quickly select colors, save color swatches, and set up color themes. See the Color Picker documentation for details.
